p: 55 samples were included in the study, with sensitivity and specificity found to be 89.4% and 94.4% for detecting laboratory defined pleocytosis (determined using a haemocytometer). Sensitivity and specificity for detecting a neutrophilic pleocytosis were 100% and 97.8% respectively, and for a mononuclear pleocytosis, 50% and 90.9%.
